revised_title: Intracellular Recognition and Sorting of Algal Symbionts in Green Hydra
tldr: The study investigates the intracellular recognition and sorting of algal symbionts in green hydra. It shows that European hydra digestive cells do not transport all native algae to the base, and a high percentage remain at the apex and disintegrate. The research also demonstrates that recognition of suitable algae is not based on a single algal character and depends on various algal properties and interactions within the host cell.
